intro: Monocera atrovirens, commonly known as the black-green monocera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
